name: Audubons Cottontail
overview: Audubonâ€™s cottontails actively forage during early morning and evenings, and spend the rest of their days in hiding. This species breeds between December and late summer, with gestation lasting only about one month and producing litters of about three offspring.
habitat: This species can be found throughout the VPGR and can even be seen grazing on campus lawns. They live and nest in underground holes that they line with grasses and fur.
